description: The ICC has rejected Bangladesh's request to shift T20 World Cup matches from India, threatening to replace them if they refuse to travel. This decision follows a dispute over pacer Mustafizur Rahman's IPL removal and Bangladesh's subsequent ban on IPL broadcasts. Scotland is poised to replace Bangladesh if they maintain their stance.

description: Karnataka governor Thaawarchand Gehlot has refused to deliver the customary address to the legislature, adding to a recent trend of gubernatorial disputes. This follows similar incidents in Kerala and Tamil Nadu, where governors clashed with state governments over speech content and assembly proceedings. The Karnataka government is set to meet the governor to understand his reasons.

description: An Indian Air Force trainer aircraft crash-landed in Prayagraj after an engine failure mid-air. The aircraft deployed an emergency parachute, allowing for a safe force-landing in an uninhabited area, with both pilots unharmed. This incident follows another aviation emergency earlier this month involving a regional connectivity flight.

description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney warned the world order is breaking apart, not evolving, during a speech at the World Economic Forum. He urged middle powers like India to unite against great power rivalry and coercion, emphasizing collective resilience over appeasement.

description: Zomato's parent company Eternal Limited CEO Deepinder Goyal is stepping down from his role, subject to shareholder approval, to pursue high-risk, experimental ideas outside the public company. He will transition to Vice Chairman on the board, with Albinder Dhindsa named as his successor.

description: Daryl Mitchell has ascended to the top of the men's ODI batting rankings, surpassing Virat Kohli after a stellar series against India. Mitchell's consecutive centuries powered New Zealand's victory and earned him the No. 1 spot with 845 rating points. Ibrahim Zadran also climbed to third, while Glenn Phillips reached 20th.

description: Sanju Samson, India's first-choice keeper for the 2026 T20 World Cup, reflects on his decade-long journey marked by failures and successes.  Having returned to his preferred opening role, Samson emphasizes his fearless approach and the importance of his bond with captain Suryakumar Yadav. He remains driven by a hunger to contribute positively.

title: She wanted to be with another man, so Lucknow woman hatched ‘nefarious plan’ to frame husband for cow slaughter – twice
Found a job, heaven knows I’m miserable: Why this Smiths lyric feels ' real' for Gen Z
description: A Smiths lyric from 1984 has become an unlikely anthem for Gen Z’s relationship with work. Drawing on viral online stories and recent research, the article explores why young people feel burned out, disengaged, and dissatisfied both during the job hunt and after getting hired—and how many are questioning whether traditional work can still deliver meaning or fulfilment.

title: Pakistan offers to host Bangladesh's T20 WC matches amid standoff with India
description: Pakistan has offered to host Bangladesh's T20 World Cup matches, backing Dhaka's refusal to play in India due to security concerns. The ICC is set to decide Bangladesh's participation amid ongoing talks. Bangladesh insists on shifting venues, while the ICC prefers the original schedule. This standoff follows recent IPL-related directives impacting Bangladeshi players.

title: Bangladesh captain Litton Das: ‘We announced the squad but not sure if we will even play at T20 World Cup or not’

Trump's Board of Peace: Is UN the real target? China emerges as unlikely defender
description: China has said it will firmly defend a United Nations–centred global order after receiving an invitation from the United States to join President Donald Trump’s proposed Gaza Board of Peace. While Beijing has not confirmed whether it will accept the offer, it stressed its commitment to the UN system and international law. The invitation has led to debate over whether the new board could emerge as a parallel peace mechanism and what it could mean for existing multilateral institutions and power balances

Watch: Outrage over half-naked men waving hookahs in Sonmarg; dancing to ‘Jaata Ka Chhora’
description: A video of bare-chested youths dancing to a Haryanvi song with hookahs in Sonmarg has sparked outrage in Kashmir. Political leaders and civil society condemned the act as provocative and disrespectful to local sentiments and cultural norms, highlighting the insensitivity of the behavior in a peaceful tourist destination.

title: Civic polls: Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena gets 'helping hand' from MNS in Kalyan-Dombivli
description: In a significant post-poll development, the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) has extended support to the Shiv Sena in the Kalyan–Dombivli Municipal Corporation. This alliance, with MNS's five corporators backing the Shiv Sena's 53, brings the total to 58, inching closer to the required majority for forming the civic body's government.

title: Since 2021, rule by rule: How the Taliban have erased women from public life
description: Since the Taliban's return in August 2021, Afghan women's basic freedoms have been systematically curtailed, transforming them into privileges. Girls are barred from secondary education and universities, most jobs are off-limits, and public spaces are restricted, severely shrinking women's public existence amid economic collapse.

title: 'ChatGPT is dying': Legendary investor says $500bn company faces collapse— read his 600-word note
description: Veteran investor George Noble warns OpenAI is "falling apart" despite its $500 billion valuation. He cites internal "Code Red" alerts, declining ChatGPT traffic, massive quarterly losses of $12 billion, and unsustainable costs for tools like Sora. Key departures and Elon Musk's lawsuit further highlight significant internal turmoil and financial strain.

title: Candace Owens pushes new theory blaming Mikey McCoy’s wife in TPUSA drama
description: Candace Owens shared a conspiracy theory claiming Elizabeth McCoy may be giving Erika Kirk bad advice at Turning Point USA. She compared the situation to Mean Girls and said the mistakes looked planned. Owens also criticized TPUSA for sending a legal letter to YouTuber Zack Gregorio, saying the move would only backfire.

title: B'desh crisis: Centres urges kin of officials to leave Dhaka; uptick in anti-India stirs
description: In response to escalating anti-India protests and potential violence in Bangladesh, India has advised families of its diplomats and officials stationed there to return home. This precautionary measure aims to ensure safety, though all Indian missions and posts in Bangladesh remain fully operational. The situation is temporary and will be reassessed.

title: Who is Cece? Twitch streamer at center of Marvel Rivals Creator Cup controversy
description: Twitch streamer Cecee faced online backlash after a heated incident during a Marvel Rivals tournament.  She insulted a teammate during a live match.  Cecee later apologized, admitting her mistakes as team captain.  She stated she reacted emotionally and failed to de-escalate the situation.  The streamer promised to improve her leadership skills.

title: 'The loneliest moment in life': Quote of the day by F Scott Fitzgerald
description: F. Scott Fitzgerald, a literary giant, captured the dazzling yet hollow spirit of America's Jazz Age. His personal struggles with wealth and love fueled his iconic novel, The Great Gatsby, a poignant critique of the American Dream. Despite initial lukewarm reception, Gatsby's enduring themes of class, illusion, and doomed aspirations have cemented its status as a timeless masterpiece.

title: Klay Thompson’s heartfelt gesture for Megan Thee Stallion leaves fans emotional
description: Klay Thompson and Megan Thee Stallion have inspired billions around the world with the love and commitment they have shown towards each other over the past few months. While Megan Thee Stallion has often spoken out about how grateful she is for Klay Thompson, the star player’s recent gesture has sparked chaos among fans.
